newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portugal's CMVM seeks more transparent markets.
newsitem.headline: Portugal's CMVM seeks more transparent markets.

text.p: Portugal's financial markets watchdog, the CMVM, said it wanted greater transparency in financial markets, swifter reporting of relevant information by companies and quarterly release of financial results.

"We are developing a diploma that would oblige quoted companies to provide quarterly financial information," Jose Nunes Pereira, president of the Financial Markets Committee (CMVM), told a news conference.
Presently only banks are obliged to provide quarterly results. Other companies must provide results every six months.
Addressing the need for greater market transparency, Nunes Pereira said: "We expect soon to produce a document that would demand the release of all relevant facts about a company.
Such facts should be divulged immediately. This is essential for the clear functioning of the market."

He added: "The immediate release of facts provides prompt information for investors and is perhaps the best way to avoid insider trading. As soon as the information is divulged, the opportunity is lost to abuse it."
